Root.title: The `Root` object (database-driven)
Root.description: The `RootConfig` object defines the global properties that are used to drive the underlying database-driven CDC-oriented code-generation.

schema.title: The default `Schema` name where the existing tables are defined within the database.
schema.description: This is used as the default `Schema` for all child objects. Defaults to `dbo` (literal).

cdcSchema.title: The schema name for the _ntangle_ generated `CDC`-related database artefacts.

cdcSchemaCreate.title: Indicates whether to create the `CdcSchema` within the database.

cdcEnable.title: Indicates whether to enable `Cdc` within the database for the tables that participate.
cdcEnable.description: Defaults to `false`. This option can be overridden for each underlying table referenced.

identifierMapping.title: Indicates whether to include the generation of the generic `CDC`-IdentifierMapping database capabilities.
identifierMapping.description: Where set to `true` each underlying `Table` and corresponding `Join` must set `IdentifierMapping` explicitly.

identifierMappingType.title: The type for the identifier mapping value.

identifierMappingStoredProcedure.title: The stored procedure name for the `Cdc`-IdentifierMapping create.

isDeletedColumn.title: The column name for the `IsDeleted` (logical delete) capability (if any).

autoDotNetRename.title: The option to automatically rename the SQL Tables and Columns for use in .NET.
autoDotNetRename.description: Defaults to `SnakeKebabToPascalCase` which will remove any underscores or hyphens separating each word and capitalize the first character of each; e.g. `internal-customer_id` would be renamed as `InternalCustomerId`. The `PascalCase` option will capatilize the first character only.

excludeColumnsFromETag.title: The default list of `Column` names that should be excluded from the generated ETag (used for the likes of duplicate send tracking)

jsonSerializer.title: The JSON Serializer to use for JSON property attribution.

service.title: The type of service that manages the underlying orchestrator.
service.description: Defaults to `None`. A `HostedService` is an `IHostedService` implementation enabling long-running execution; whereas, `Service` is intended for self-managed execution.

eventSubjectRoot.title: The root for the event name by prepending to all event subject names via CDC.
eventSubjectRoot.description: Used to enable the sending of messages to the likes of EventHubs, Service Broker, Kafka, etc.

eventSubjectFormat.title: The default formatting for the Subject when an Event is published via CDC.

eventActionFormat.title: The formatting for the Action when an Event is published via CDC.
eventActionFormat.description: Defaults to `None` (no formatting required, i.e. as-is).

eventSourceKind.title: The URI kind for the event source URIs for CDC.

eventSourceRoot.title: The URI root for the event source by prepending to all event source URIs for CDC.
eventSourceRoot.description: The event source is only updated where an `EventSourceKind` is not `None`.

eventSourceFormat.title: The default formatting for the Source when an Event is published via CDC.
eventSourceFormat.description: Defaults to `NameAndTableKey` (being the child `Cdc.ModelName` appended with the corresponding table key).

eventTypeRoot.title: The root for the event type by prepending to all event type names via CDC.
eventTypeRoot.description: Used to enable the sending of messages to the likes of EventHubs, Service Broker, Kafka, etc. Defaults to `EventSubjectRoot`.

outbox.title: Indicates whether to generate the event outbox SQL and .NET artefacts.

outboxSchema.title: The schema name of the event outbox table.

outboxSchemaCreate.title: Indicates whether to create the `OutboxSchema` within the database.

outboxTable.title: The name of the event outbox table.

outboxEnqueueStoredProcedure.title: The stored procedure name for the event outbox enqueue.

outboxDequeueStoredProcedure.title: The stored procedure name for the event outbox dequeue.

pathBase.title: The base path (directory) prefix for the Database-related artefacts; other `Path*` properties append to this value when they are not specifically overridden.

pathDatabase.title: The root path (directory) for the Database-related artefacts.

pathDatabaseSchema.title: The path (directory) for the Schema Database-related artefacts.

pathDatabaseMigrations.title: The path (directory) for the Schema Database-related artefacts.

pathDotNetPublisher.title: The path (directory) for the CDC-related (.NET) artefacts.

pathSidecarDatabase.title: The path (directory) for the Schema Database-related artefacts.

pathSidecarDatabaseSchema.title: The path (directory) for the Schema Database-related artefacts.

pathSidecarDatabaseMigrations.title: The path (directory) for the Schema Database-related artefacts.

namespaceBase.title: The base Namespace (root) for the .NET artefacts.

namespacePublisher.title: The Namespace (root) for the CDC-related Publisher .NET artefacts.

namespaceOutbox.title: The Namespace (root) for the Outbox-related Publisher .NET artefacts.

tables.title: The corresponding `Table` collection.
tables.description: A `Table` object provides the primary database table configuration for Change Data Capture (CDC), including multiple child table joins to form a composite entity.

Table.title: 'Table' object (database-driven)
Table.description: The `Table` object enables the definition of the primary table, one-or-more child tables and their respective join relationships, to enable Change Data Capture (CDC) event publishing. The `IncludeColumns` and `ExcludeColumns` provide a shorthand to include or exclude selected columns; with the `AliasColumns` providing a means to rename where required.

name.title: The name of the primary table.

schema.title: The default schema name used where not otherwise explicitly specified.

table.title: The name of the primary table.
table.description: Defaults to `Name`. This is used to specify the actual underlying database table name (required where the `Name` has been changed to enable uniqueness).

alias.title: The table alias name (must be unique).
alias.description: Will automatically default where not specified; for example a table named `Person` will default to `p`.

includeColumns.title: The list of `Column` names to be included in the underlying generated output.
includeColumns.description: Where not specified this indicates that all `Columns` are to be included.

excludeColumns.title: The list of `Column` names to be excluded from the underlying generated output.
excludeColumns.description: Where not specified this indicates no `Columns` are to be excluded.

aliasColumns.title: The list of `Column` and `Alias` pairs (split by a `^` lookup character) to enable column aliasing/renaming.
aliasColumns.description: Each alias value should be formatted as `Column` + `^` + `Alias`; e.g. `PCODE^ProductCode`.

trackingStoredProcedure.title: The `CDC` _tracking_ (Sidecar only) batch stored procedure name.

cdcSchema.title: The schema name for the generated `CDC`-related database artefacts.

batchTrackingTable.title: The corresponding `CDC` Batch tracking table name.

cdcEnable.title: Indicates whether to enable `Cdc` within the database for the tables that participate.
cdcEnable.description: Defaults to `false`. This option can be overridden for each underlying table referenced.

orchestratorCtorParams.title: The list of additional (non-default) Dependency Injection (DI) parameters for the generated CDC `Orchestrator` constructor.
orchestratorCtorParams.description: Each constructor parameter should be formatted as `Type` + `^` + `Name`; e.g. `IConfiguration^Config`. Where the `Name` portion is not specified it will be inferred.

database.title: The .NET database `IDatabase` Type name used in the constructor for Dependency Injection (DI).

includeColumnsOnDelete.title: The list of `Column` names that should be included (in addition to the primary key) for a logical delete.
includeColumnsOnDelete.description: Where a column is not specified in this list its corresponding .NET property will be automatically cleared by the `CdcDataOrchestrator` as the data is technically considered as non-existing.

service.title: The type of service that manages the underlying orchestrator.
service.description: Defaults to `Root.Service`. A `HostedService` is an `IHostedService` implementation enabling long-running execution; whereas, `Service` is intended for self-managed execution.

excludeColumnsFromETag.title: The list of `Column` names that should be excluded from the generated ETag (used for the likes of duplicate send tracking).

tenantIdColumns.title: The list of `Column` names that represent the tenant identifier.

partitionKey.title: The partition key.
partitionKey.description: A partition key can be specified using either `PartitionKey` or `PartitionKeyColumns`.

partitionKeyColumns.title: The list of `Column` names that represent the partition key.
partitionKeyColumns.description: A partition key can be specified using either `PartitionKey` or `PartitionKeyColumns`.

eventSource.title: The Event Source.
eventSource.description: Defaults to `Schema` + `/` (literal) + `Name` (as lowercase). Note: when used in code-generation the `Root.EventSourceRoot` will be prepended where specified.

eventSourceFormat.title: The default formatting for the Source when an Event is published.

eventSubject.title: The Event Subject.
eventSubject.description: Defaults to `ModelName`. Note: when used in code-generation the `Root.EventSubjectRoot` will be prepended where specified.

eventSubjectFormat.title: The default formatting for the Subject when an Event is published.

eventType.title: The Event Type.
eventType.description: Defaults to `ModelName`. Note: when used in code-generation the `Root.EventTypeRoot` will be prepended where specified.

identifierMapping.title: Indicates whether to perform Identifier Mapping (mapping to `GlobalId`) for the primary key.
identifierMapping.description: This indicates whether to create a new `GlobalId` property on the _entity_ to house the global mapping identifier to be the reference outside of the specific database realm as a replacement to the existing primary key column(s).

identifierName.title: The JSON name for the `GlobalId` property where `IdentifierMapping` is `true`. Defaults to `globalId`.
identifierName.description: This indicates whether to create a new `GlobalId` property on the _entity_ to house the global mapping identifier to be the reference outside of the specific database realm as a replacement to the existing primary key column(s).

isDeletedColumn.title: The column name for the `IsDeleted` (logical delete) capability (if any).

joins.title: The corresponding `Join` collection.
joins.description: A `Join` object provides the configuration for a table join.

where.title: The corresponding `Where` collection.
where.description: A `Where` object provides the configuration for a table where clause.

Join.title: 'Join' object (database-driven)
Join.description: The `Join` object defines a join to another (or same) table within the logical CDC entity.  The `IncludeColumns` and `ExcludeColumns` provide a shorthand to include or exclude selected columns; with the `AliasColumns` providing a means to rename where required.

name.title: The unique name.
name.description: A unique name is required where the same `Table` is referenced more than once within a logical CDC entity. However, generally, this will represent the unique name of the table within the database.

schema.title: The schema name of the table to join.

table.title: The name of the table to join.
table.description: Defaults to `Name`. This is used to specify the actual underlying database table name (required where the `Name` has been changed to enable uniqueness).

alias.title: The `Schema` and `Table` alias name.
alias.description: Will automatically default where not specified.

type.title: The SQL join type.
type.description: Defaults to `Cdc`. The `Cdc` value indicates this is a related secondary table (within a logical CDC entity) that also has Change Data Capture turned on and equally needs to be monitored for changes.

joinTo.title: The name of the table to join to (must be previously specified).

joinCardinality.title: The join cardinality being whether there is a One-to-Many or One-to-One relationship.
joinCardinality.description: Defaults to `OneToMany`. This represents the Parent (`JoinTo`) to child (_this_) relationship.

cdcEnable.title: Indicates whether to enable `Cdc` within the database for the tables that participate.
cdcEnable.description: Defaults to `false`. This option can be overridden for each underlying table referenced.

querySizeMultiplier.title: The query size multiplier for the CDC-Join.
querySizeMultiplier.description: Defaults to `1.0`. This is applied to the execute stored procedure `@MaxQuerySize` parameter to allow tailoring on the join query (`TOP`) sizes to optimize selection. Must be greater than zero and less than or equal to 100.

includeColumns.title: The list of `Column` names to be included in the underlying generated output.
includeColumns.description: Where not specified this indicates that all `Columns` are to be included.

excludeColumns.title: The list of `Column` names to be excluded from the underlying generated output.
excludeColumns.description: Where not specified this indicates no `Columns` are to be excluded.

aliasColumns.title: The list of `Column` and `Alias` pairs (split by a `^` lookup character) to enable column renaming.
aliasColumns.description: Each alias value should be formatted as `Column` + `^` + `Alias`; e.g. `PCODE^ProductCode`

property.title: The .NET property name.
property.description: Defaults to `Model` where `JoinCardinality` is `OneToOne`; otherwise, it will be the `Model` pluralized.

includeColumnsOnDelete.title: The list of `Column` names that should be included (in addition to the primary key) for a logical delete.
includeColumnsOnDelete.description: Where a column is not specified in this list its corresponding .NET property will be automatically cleared by the `CdcDataOrchestrator` as the data is technically considered as non-existing.

excludeColumnsFromETag.title: The list of `Column` names that should be excluded from the generated ETag (used for the likes of duplicate send tracking).

identifierMapping.title: Indicates whether to perform Identifier Mapping (mapping to `GlobalId`) for the primary key.
identifierMapping.description: This indicates whether to create a new `GlobalId` property on the _entity_ to house the global mapping identifier to be the reference outside of the specific database realm as a replacement to the existing primary key column(s).

identifierName.title: The JSON name for the `GlobalId` property where `IdentifierMapping` is `true`. Defaults to `globalId`.
identifierName.description: This indicates whether to create a new `GlobalId` property on the _entity_ to house the global mapping identifier to be the reference outside of the specific database realm as a replacement to the existing primary key column(s).

JoinOn.title: 'JoinOn' object (database-driven)
JoinOn.description: The `JoinOn` object defines the join on characteristics for a `Join` object.

name.title: The name of the join column (from the `Join` table).

toColumn.title: The name of the join to column.
toColumn.description: Defaults to `Name`; i.e. assumes same name.

toStatement.title: The SQL statement for the join on bypassing the corresponding `ToColumn` specification.

JoinMapping.title: 'JoinMapping' object (database-driven)
JoinMapping.description: The `JoinMapping` object defines one or more related table identifier mappings.

name.title: The name of of the existing column that requires identifier mapping.

schema.title: The schema name of the related table.
schema.description: Defaults to the owning (parent) table schema.

table.title: The name of the related table.

Where.title: 'Where' object (database-driven)
Where.description: This should only be used where the column value is largely immutable; otherwise, unintended side-effects may occur. _NTangle_ uses the condition explictily and does not attempt to handle value change to infer creation or deletion of data as a result of the underlying change; as such, this should be used cautiously. Note that the `where` is applied when querying the `cdc.fn_cdc_get_all_changes_...` function, not the underlying table itself.

nullable.title: The where nullability clause operator
nullable.description: This enables statements such as `WHERE (COL IS NULL)` or `WHERE (COL IS NULL OR COL = VALUE)` (where .

value.title: The comparison value
value.description: This must be valid formatted/escaped SQL.

TableMapping.title: 'TableMapping' object (database-driven)
TableMapping.description: The `TableMapping` object defines one or more related table identifier mappings.

name.title: The name of of the existing column that requires identifier mapping.

schema.title: The schema name of the related table.
schema.description: Defaults to the owning (parent) table schema.

table.title: The name of the related table.
